title: Employer goes on an extraordinary rant at a woman after she applies to work at his company
text:
A woman who was rejected for a job because she 'didn't have enough experience' has hit back at the potential employer after being called a 'lazy, jobless disgrace'.

The Sunshine Coast woman applied for a delivery driver job for an interior design business on Seek and within a few minutes, the employer viewed her application and sent her an abusive email in response.

The email chastised her for having no relevant experience, even though she worked part-time as a pizza delivery driver, and said she was a 'disgrace.'

The employer also accused her of only applying for the position to fulfil requirements to collect the dole from Centrelink.

A young woman was recently made redundant from her full-time job and used the employment website Seek to help support her family

The woman was recently made redundant from her full-time job.

She shared her story and the abusive email in a Sunshine Coast Community Facebook page.

'The words ''lazy, jobless disgrace'' are how they ended the email to me. It's hurtful, it's untrue and it's really not OK,' she told the Sunshine Coast Daily.

'They don't even know me or what I have been through in life, and they have thrown me into a stereotype because I applied for their job.'

She said her current role as a pizza delivery driver for a business in Noosa Heads would make her a great candidate for the role.

The Sunshine Coast woman (stock image) was harshly rejected after applying for a delivery driver job

She imagined how someone who was not as strong as her would have reacted if they received a similar abusive email from a potential employer.

'I'm a strong person, but if it was someone that was really struggling and had been trying to get a job for ages and was having no luck, if they were fragile, and got that response, it probably wouldn't' have ended very well at all.'

The identity of the person who sent the email is unknown to the woman as it was signed off with 'Seek Employer' with no further information.

Seek has been contacted for comment.
description: A Sunshine Coast woman who was rejected for a job because she 'didn't have enough experience' has hit back at the potential employer after being called a 'lazy, jobless disgrace'.
authors: Thomas Duff For Daily Mail Australia
